de.latlon.deejump.wfs.jump

Class WFSLayerListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.latlon.deejump.wfs.jump.WFSLayerListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LayerListener

    public class WFSLayerListener
extends Object
implements LayerListener
    This class keeps track of changes to its layer. It is intended to be used with a WFSLayer only. Getters allow access to list and maps with the changed features. These are used by the UpdataWFSLayerPlugIn (and TransactionFactory) to generated the WFS Transaction requests.
    Author:
    Ugo Taddei

    • Method Detail

      • featuresChanged

        public void featuresChanged(FeatureEvent e)
        Keeps tracks of changes to the associated layer (the layer is associated using its display name). The four FeatureEventTypes are treated separatedly. GEOMETRY_MODIFIED ATTRIBUTE_MODIFIED are combined by the TransactionFactory into one UPDATE statement.
        Changed features (and the reference to their riginal features) can be retrieved with the methods getChangedFeaturesMap(), getOldGeomFeaturesMap() and getAttrGeomFeaturesMap().
        Specified by:
        featuresChanged in interface LayerListener
        See Also:
        LayerListener.featuresChanged(com.vividsolutions.jump.workbench.model.FeatureEvent)

      • getChangedFeaturesMap

        public HashMap<FeatureEventType,ArrayList<Feature>> getChangedFeaturesMap()
        Returns:
        a map containing lists of changed, deleted or added features. The keys to access those lists are the FeatureEventTypes. For example, the key FeatureEventType.ATTRIBUTES_MODIFIED can be used to retireve the list of features with changed attributes.

      • layerChanged

        public void layerChanged(LayerEvent e)
        Specified by:

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Clears up lists and maps with changed, added or deleted features.
